page.title: 06Animal life on Papa Stour.
page.content: There are no amphibians and very few wild mammals on the island.Rabbits abound in the sand dunes because they have no natural predators. There is a healthy otter population, but because they are secretive animals their tracks rather than sightings betray them.Hill mice are very common as any crofter will tell you! By far the richest source of animal life is in the sea.Last week we found 30 species of animal in the rock pools at low tide.Pilot whales{caain whales} and porpoises {neesik}are a common sight playing around the boats,killer whales are not as common.The sea is a home to mackeral,whiteing,scallops crab and lobster,which are all fished commercially. Grey and Common seals,{selkies},are a frequent sight,especially when they come ashore to have their pups.
